Description: Frequency domain signal taken as a Fast Fourier Transform of the time-based signals.
Jerk signal: body linear acceleration derived with respect to time.
Jerk signal: body angular velocity  derived with respect to time.
Magnitude of Jerk signal: body linear acceleration derived with respect to time.
Magnitude of Jerk signal: body angular velocity  derived with respect to time.
Energy measure. Sum of the squares divided by the number of values.
Autorregresion coefficients with Burg order equal to 4.
index of the frequency component with largest magnitude.
Weighted average of the frequency components to obtain a mean frequency.
skewness of the frequency domain signal.
kurtosis of the frequency domain signal.
Energy of a frequency interval within the 64 bins of the FFT of each window.
